Memasuki Musim Hujan, PVMBG Waspadai Aktivitas 3 Gunung Api
01 Nov 2019, 00:30 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Ilustrasi aktivitas Gunung Anak Krakatau. (ANTARA FOTO/Muhammad Adimaja)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Pusat Vulkanologi dan Mitigasi Bencana Geologi (PVMBG) mendeteksi terdapat tiga gunung api yang perlu diwaspadai jelang memasuki musim penghujan. Kepala Subbidang Mitigasi Gunung Api PVMBG Devy Kamil Syahbana memaparkan gunung api itu antara lain Gunung Karangetang di Sulawesi Utara, Gunung Anak Krakatau di Lampung, serta Gunung Merapi di Yogyakarta dan Jawa Tengah.Karangetang kini berstatus siaga sementara dua lainnya ada di status waspada atau level II."Untuk level normal, meskipun levelnya normal tapi gunung api ini berbeda dengan gunung lainnya. Jadi masih ada aktivitas erupsi, ini ada 47 gunung api. Lalu level II yakni waspada ada 19 gunung api, level III atau siaga ada tiga gunung api dan level IV atau awas itu tidak ada," terang Devy saat konferensi pers di Gedung BNPB, Jakarta Timur, Kamis (31/10)."Karangetang ini yang paling tinggi ditandai dengan guguran lava hingga sejauh 1.000 hingga 1.750 meter dan hembusan asap setinggi 25 hingga 600 meter," jelas dia lagi.


Gunung Karangetang. (ANTARA FOTO/Adwit B Pramono)

DiÂ Karangetang, PVMBG merekomendasikan masyarakat untuk tidak mendekati atau beraktivitas di radius 2,5 kilometer.Sementara rekomendasi untuk warga di sekitar Gunung Anak Krakatau diimbau menjauh hingga radius 2 kilometer. Tapi warga yang melaut masih bisa beraktivitas karena potensi bahaya diperkirakan hanya di sekitar Pulau Anak Krakatau."Sampai sekarang aktivitas erupsi masih berlangsung namun tingkat eksplosivitas masih rendah. Tipe bahayanya berupa lontaran material erupsi di sekitar kawah," tutur dia.Adapun untuk warga di sekitar Gunung Merapi, PVMBG mengimbau warga agar tak beraktivitas di radius 3 kilometer. Selain itu jika terjadi erupsi hujan abu maka warga diiumbau menggunakan masker dan kacamata serta mewaspadai aliran lahar."Gunung api ini terus mengalami erupsi tapi dengan rate yang lambat. Peluang terjadi erupsi seperti 2010 masih sangat rendah. Apa yang mungkin terjadi adalah guguran lava dan erupsi, terakhir 14 Oktober lalu ada sekali serupsi 3.000 meter diikuti awan panas dan maksimum 2 kilometer," tutur Devy.Secara umum bencana gunung api tak semata dipengaruhi musim hujan akan tetapi Devy menuturkan ada sejumlah potensi bahaya yang perlu diwaspadai di antaranya gerakan tanah atau longsor, akumulasi gas vulkanik beracun di area kawah saat cuaca mendung juga guguran kubah lava."Di musim hujan ini hujan mampu men-trigger kubah lava yang tidak aktif tapi juga tidak stabil bisa dipicu oleh hujan untuk menjadi guguran, longsoran, atau bahkan bisa menjadi lahar hujan," terang dia.Pada periode Oktober ini PVMBG mencatat sejumlah gunung api yang mengalami erupsi berupa letusan antara lain Anak Krakatau berupa sebanyak 232 kali, gunung api Ibu di Halmahera 1.705 kali, Dukono sebanyak empat kali letusan, Semeru sebanyak 637 kali, Merapi satu kali letusan, dan Kerinci pun satu kali letusan diikuti emisi abu.Sementara yang mengalami guguran antara lain Gunung Merapi sebanyak 238 kali, Soputan sebanyak 254 kali dan Karangetang sebanyak 3.497 kali.


Gunung Merapi. (ANTARA FOTO/Aloysius Jarot Nugroho)

Kendati begitu pada Oktober ini terjadi penurunan status dua gunung api yakni Soputan menjadi berstatus waspada (level II) dan Tangkuban Parahu yang kembali ke status normal (level I).Secara umum data PVMBG menunjukkan terdapat 127 Gunung Api aktif. Jumlah ini merupakan yang terbanyak di dunia. Kalau ditotal, jalur gunung api ini mulai dari Sumatra, Jawa, Bali, Nusa Tenggara, Banda, Halmahera hingga Sulawesi Utara sepanjang 7.000 kilometer."Yang jadi permasalahan adalah saat ini masih banyak orang tinggal di sekitar kawasan rawan bencana gunung api yakni sekitar 4 juta orang," ungkap Devy. (ika/ain)

Entering the Rainy Season, PVMBG Beware of the Activity of 3 Volcanoes
01 Nov 2019, 00:30 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Illustration of Mount Anak Krakatau's activities. (BETWEEN PHOTOS / Muhammad Adimaja)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - The Center for Volcanology and Geological Disaster Mitigation (PVMBG) has detected three volcanoes that need to be watched before entering the rainy season. Head of the PVMBG Volcano Mitigation Subdivision Devy Kamil Syahbana explained the volcano included Mount Karangetang in North Sulawesi, Mount Anak Krakatau in Lampung, and Mount Merapi in Yogyakarta and Central Java. Karangetang is now on alert while the other two are on alert or level II status "For a normal level, although the level is normal, this volcano is different from other mountains. So there is still eruption activity, there are 47 volcanoes. Then level II is alert there are 19 volcanoes, level III or standby there are three volcanoes and level IV or there is no such thing, "explained Devy during a press conference at the BNPB Building, East Jakarta, Thursday (10/31)." The highest Karangetang is marked by lava falls as far as 1,000 to 1,750 meters and blowing smoke as high as 25 to 600 meters, "he explained again.


Mount Karangetang. (BETWEEN PHOTOS / Adwit B Pramono)

In Karangetang, PVMBG recommends that people not approach or do activities within a 2.5 kilometer radius. Meanwhile, recommendations for residents around Mount Anak Krakatau are advised to move away to a radius of 2 kilometers. But residents who go to sea can still move because the potential danger is estimated only around the Anak Krakatau Island. "Until now the eruption activity is still ongoing but the level of exploitation is still low. The danger is in the form of a burst of eruption material around the crater," he said. Mount Merapi, PVMBG urges residents not to move in a radius of 3 kilometers. In addition, if there is an ash rain eruption then residents are encouraged to wear masks and glasses and be aware of lava flows. "This volcano continues to experience an eruption but at a slow rate. The chances of an eruption such as 2010 are still very low. What might happen is lava and eruption. "The last, October 14, there was a 3,000 meter eruption followed by hot clouds and a maximum of 2 kilometers," said Devy. In general, volcanic disasters are not only affected by the rainy season, but Devy said there are a number of potential dangers that need to be watched out including land movements or landslides, accumulation of toxic volcanic gas in the crater area when the weather is cloudy also lava dome. "In the rainy season this rain is able to trigger a lava dome that is not active but also unstable can be triggered by rain to become a fall, avalanche, or even can become rain lava , "he explained. In this October PVMBG recorded a number of volcanoes that experienced an eruption in the form of an eruption between la in Anak Krakatau in the form of 232 times, Ibu volcano in Halmahera 1,705 times, Dukono four eruptions, Semeru 637 times, Merapi one eruption, and Kerinci was one eruption followed by ash emissions. While those who experienced a fall include Mount Merapi 238 times, Soputan 254 times and Karangetang 3,497 times.


Mount Merapi. (BETWEEN PHOTOS / Aloysius Jarot Nugroho)

Even so, this October there was a decline in the status of two volcanoes, namely Soputan being alert (level II) and Tangkuban Parahu returning to normal status (level I). In general, PVMBG data shows that there are 127 active volcanoes. This number is the most in the world. If totaled, the volcano's path starts from Sumatra, Java, Bali, Nusa Tenggara, Banda, Halmahera to North Sulawesi along 7,000 kilometers. "The problem is that at this time there are still many people living around the volcano-prone areas which are around 4 million people, "Devy revealed. (ika / ain)
